title: Diotima
content:
[Gudrun Zapf von Hesse](http://web.archive.org/web/20120813224031/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Gudrun%20Zapf%20von%20Hesse) designed the Diotima type family for [D. Stempel AG](http://web.archive.org/web/20120813224031/http:/typophile.com/wiki/D.%20Stempel%20AG) during the late 1940s and early 1950s.

[Hermann Zapf](http://web.archive.org/web/20120813224031/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hermann%20Zapf) set their wedding invitation in this face, instead of in [Palatino](http://web.archive.org/web/20120813224031/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Palatino). What more could attest to its inherent quality?

A digital version of the face is available today from [Linotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20120813224031/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Linotype). Click here to see [all of the Diotima weights on the Linotype website](http://web.archive.org/web/20120813224031/http:/www.linotype.com/335/diotima-family.html).

Zapf von Hesse designed wo sets of titling capitals to harmonize with Diotima: [Ariadne Initials](http://web.archive.org/web/20120813224031/http:/www.linotype.com/54/ariadne-family.html) and [Smaragd](http://web.archive.org/web/20120813224031/http:/www.linotype.com/1485/smaragd-family.html).
author: dan_reynolds
